reviews.review_msg: Read old exams to clue into his thoughts.  Hard lectures, OK exams.

She's absolutely lovely. Definitely recommend for upper-div. classes. Her jokes will make you smile, class is always a comfortable learning environment, and her feedback is incredibly valuable for anybody planning on doing future statistical work/study. Thanks Jane!

ECON435 has been my most favorite class that I have taken at SFU. Jane's lectures are engaging, the assignments are relevant, her feedback is constructive and her grading is fair. The knowledge and skills I have learned in this class are extremely applicable to real-world problems. I would highly recommend this course to all ECON students.

Can't stress more how awesome his class is. There are weekly written assignments and R Lab assignments and readings, but you won't get lost, because he is very organized and his course is well-structured and informative. The learning curve is very smooth, and the course proceeds at just the right pace.

Clear grading criteria is supplemented with strict marking based on his expectations. A great prof that cares about students makes the class enjoyable. Class is applicable and extremely interesting (imo), with skills in R developed through assignments and term paper. If you ever have the chance to take a class with Chris - DO IT!
Chris is an genuinely  nice guy.  This was a well structured course and you could tell he cared about how students did. Recommended professor.

I guess Econ435 is one of the most difficult course in SFU.  It's the mixture of Math, Stat, and Econ.  Brian understands the material very well. He is able to sit beside you and explain it for times. The midterms were tough and long, but as long as you do well on the term paper, the bad marks from midterms can be waived. Hard course but good prof!

This is a hard course that requires a lot of work but is 100% worth it. He is great at breaking down confusing concepts with anecdotes and relevant examples. It can get complicated with all the math but he makes it clear that you dont need to perfectly understand everything at this level. Absolute pro at teaching R in a way you wont forget.

Quite honestly, the hardest ECON course I've ever taken. This course was brutal, but he genuinely wanted you to succeed. We covered A LOT more material than we were supposed to by accident. Probably not the course non-quant ECON majors want to take. That said, it was absolutely worth taking. Great instructor. Insanely hard course.

He's actually nice and always down to explain things, but you need to approach him. I'd say he just assumes that all students have the same level of understanding, which makes his lecture seem dull and hard to grasp for Econ students who haven't taken any STAT before.
He is very funny and very good.. although we were talking about econometrics, he always kept the class interested.. even when the math was too much. It's sad that  he has moved to France
He's funny sometimes. But, his lecture is so fast and he has strong accent.
